docs.snippet: After missing three straight Sprint Cup races because of lingering effects of a concussion, Dale Earnhardt Jr. made his first public appearance....
docs.lead_paragraph: After missing three straight Sprint Cup races because of lingering effects of a concussion, Dale Earnhardt Jr. made his first public appearance.

headline.main: Injured Dale Earnhardt Jr. Is Frustrated but Resolute
headline.print_headline: Injured Earnhardt Is Frustrated but Resolute

docs.snippet: Despite the criticisms and fears swirling around the Games, they have begun, and for better or worse, Rio will have its moment....
docs.lead_paragraph: Despite the criticisms and fears swirling around the Games, they have begun, and for better or worse, Rio will have its moment.
docs.abstract: Juliet Macur Sports of The Times column discusses difficulties faced by Brazil in staging 2016 Olympics, which include dealing with polluted waters, high crime and political upheaval.

headline.main: For the Rio Olympic Games, There’s No Turning Back Now
headline.print_headline: For Better or Worse, the Show Must Go On

docs.snippet: The International Boxing Association decided to eliminate the guards for amateur male boxers, concluding that they did not prevent concussions....
docs.lead_paragraph: The International Boxing Association decided to eliminate the guards for amateur male boxers, concluding that they did not prevent concussions.
docs.abstract: Male boxers competing in Rio Olympics will do so without protective headgear for first time based on argument that they will be safer without it; several studies, including one commissioned by International Boxing Assn, argue that number of acute brain injuries actually declined when head guards were not in use; critics of decision say findings are suspect, and decision has more to do with drawing in fans than keeping boxers safe.

headline.main: Making Olympic Boxing Safer by Eliminating Head Guards

docs.snippet: Russian wrestler Viktor Lebedev, a two-time world champion, has been cleared to take part in the Rio Olympics, TASS news agency reported on Saturday, citing Sports Minister Vitaly Mutko....
docs.lead_paragraph: Russian wrestler Viktor Lebedev, a two-time world champion, has been cleared to take part in the Rio Olympics, TASS news agency reported on Saturday, citing Sports Minister Vitaly Mutko.

headline.main: Russian Wrestler Lebedev Cleared for Rio Games-Sports Minister
headline.print_headline: Russian Wrestler Lebedev Cleared for Rio Games-Sports Minister

docs.snippet: A small blast shook the area near the finish line of the men's cycling road race Saturday with about 70 kilometers to go in the race. No one was injured, and the event went on unaffected....
docs.lead_paragraph: A small blast shook the area near the finish line of the men's cycling road race Saturday with about 70 kilometers to go in the race. No one was injured, and the event went on unaffected.

headline.main: Police: Blast at Cycling Was Controlled Explosion of Bag
headline.print_headline: Police: Blast at Cycling Was Controlled Explosion of Bag

docs.snippet: American TV viewers used social media on Friday to vent their anger at U.S. broadcaster NBC for delaying the screening of the opening ceremony of the Rio Games by an hour and then going to repeated commercial breaks during the show....
docs.lead_paragraph: American TV viewers used social media on Friday to vent their anger at U.S. broadcaster NBC for delaying the screening of the opening ceremony of the Rio Games by an hour and then going to repeated commercial breaks during the show.

headline.main: American TV Viewers Slam NBC for Delaying Rio Broadcast
headline.print_headline: American TV Viewers Slam NBC for Delaying Rio Broadcast

docs.snippet: An estimated 26.5 million people watched NBC's coverage of the Olympic opening ceremony, a sharp 35 percent drop from the record-setting viewership of the curtain-lifter in London four years ago....
docs.lead_paragraph: An estimated 26.5 million people watched NBC's coverage of the Olympic opening ceremony, a sharp 35 percent drop from the record-setting viewership of the curtain-lifter in London four years ago.

headline.main: Olympic Viewing: NBC's Ratings Drop, Chaotic Bike Race
headline.print_headline: Olympic Viewing: NBC's Ratings Drop, Chaotic Bike Race

docs.snippet: The president headed into his two-week break in an unusually festive mood, having just celebrated his 55th birthday and with Hillary Clinton ahead in the polls....
docs.lead_paragraph: The president headed into his two-week break in an unusually festive mood, having just celebrated his 55th birthday and with Hillary Clinton ahead in the polls.
docs.abstract: Pres Obama begins his last summer vacation with his family as president in Martha's Vineyard, where he is expected to spend his time reading and playing golf.

headline.main: Obama Arrives in Martha’s Vineyard for Two-Week Vacation
headline.print_headline: A Final Summer Vacation in Office for Obama

docs.snippet: Glasgow Rangers ended their four-year exile from the Scottish Premier League with a disappointing 1-1 draw against Hamilton Academical at Ibrox on Saturday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Glasgow Rangers ended their four-year exile from the Scottish Premier League with a disappointing 1-1 draw against Hamilton Academical at Ibrox on Saturday.

headline.main: Rangers Rescue Draw on Scottish Premier League Return
headline.print_headline: Rangers Rescue Draw on Scottish Premier League Return

docs.snippet: Two dozen concertgoers in northeast Ohio suffered medical symptoms Saturday after they ate candy laced with a drug found in marijuana....
docs.lead_paragraph: Two dozen concertgoers in northeast Ohio suffered medical symptoms Saturday after they ate candy laced with a drug found in marijuana.

headline.main: 24 Treated After Eating Drug-Laced Candy at Rap Concert
headline.print_headline: 24 Treated After Eating Drug-Laced Candy at Rap Concert
